What's next?Report with key discussion points, working paper on FR indicators &start integrating indicators across ongoing projects #FRASymp
Morten Kjaerum: It's not merely an academic effort, but it needs to be institutionalised #FRASymp
Up next: Closing remarks by FRA Director Morten Kjaerum #FRASymp
#FRASymp participant: There's a huge gap between what we build ("the fetishism of indicators“) and what is implemented on the ground.
Main challenges: data protection (hard to identify ethnicity), unavailable data, missing context and lack of comparability #FRASymp
J. Grimheden: When building indicators, we usually focus on vulnerable groups, but we mustn't forget about the majority population #FRASymp
Conclusions: we need to move beyond definitions, check how comparable the data is and engage in broader validation processes #FRASymp
J. Goodey and J. Grimheden summarize: we have a common need for comparable data and qualitative in addition to quantitative data #FRASymp
Up next: The thematic working groups presenting yesterday's findings #FRASymp
Now speaking: Mila Paspalanova, Senior Human Rights Assistant at OHCHR Mexico #FRASymp
J. Niessen: #Transparency and knowledge of national policies, changes and trends is a major aim of MIPEX #FRASymp
Jan Niessen (Migration Policy Group), presented the Migrant Integration Policy Index (MIPEX) #FRASymp
Hans-Otto Sano (World Bank): More larger scale #humanrights data projects and regular data availability is needed #FRASymp
We had some problems with our #Twitter account for the last hour. We apologize for the inconvenience #FRASymp
M.Scarone: UNESCO's integrated approach includes cooperation with municipal authorities and a "Cities against Racism" coalition, #FRASymp
Now speaking: Marcello Scarone Azzi from the Division of Human Rights at UNESCO #FRASymp
A. Henry: #Equality indicators and #humanrights indicators must be linked together. #FRASymp

Afternoon session: working groups on data protection, access to justice, child rights, Roma, persons with disabilities; stay tuned! #FRASymp
Joanna Goodey: Absent or inadequate #fundamentalrights data from EU Member States are one of the major challenges for #FRA's work #FRASymp
E. Felner: As ingredients only are not enough to cook a meal, indicators don't suffice to assess the #fundamentalrights situation. #FRASymp
Eitan Felner: economic, social and cultural rights indicators and civil and political rights indicators are equally important #FRASymp
Todd Landman: national #humanrights monitoring is not about ranking countries, but about grouping and comparing data #FRAsymp
Angela Me: Data collected only by national statistical offices not sufficient for monitoring #fundamentalrights on a large scale. #FRASymp
The panelists: Angela Me (UNODC), Todd Landman (IDCR, University of Essex), Eitan Felner (Int'l Consultant), Jo Goodey (FRA) #FRASymp
Up next: Panel debate on developing and using indicators for promoting and assessing the implementation of #humanrights in the #EU #FRASymp
T. Phillips: The idea of #equality must be an essential component of social and economic policy when approaching recovery #FRASymp
T. Phillips: #Discrimination can be subtle, so that indicators are required to measure it and to make it visible #FRASymp
Now speaking: Trevor Phillips from the UK's Equality and Human Rights Commission (EHRC) #FRASymp
C. Mokhiber: #fundamentalrights initiatives on regional and national level very important for OHCHR's work #FRASymp
C. Mokhiber: Indicators need an authoritive #humanrights framework to be successfully implemented #FRASymp
C. Mokhiber: The idea of #humanrights indicators is not new, but their implementation needs to be improved #FRASymp
Now speaking: Craig Mokhiber from the Office of the #UN High Commissioner for Human Rights #FRASymp
A Ciobanu-Dordea: Efficient data collection is needed to improve the #fundamentalrights situation of #Roma people in Europe #FRASymp
A. Ciobanu-Dordea: Indicators can also contribute to the consolidation of the #EU #FRASymp
A. Ciobanu-Dordea: Indicators are one of the best tools to define and tackle #fundamentalrights issues. #FRASymp
A.Ciobanu-Dordea: As economic crisis puts public service under pressure, indicators can make #fundamentalrights work more efficient #FRASymp
Now speaking: Aurel Ciobanu-Dordea from the European Commission #FRASymp
#FRA Director Morten Kjaerum now addresses the #FRASymp participants
#fundamentalrights indicators can of course never replace analysis and monitoring, Ilze Brands Kehris says #FRASymp
